clinical_study.brief_title: In Vivo Glycocalyx as Predictor of Complications After Cardiac Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Glycocalyx as Predictor of Complications After Cardiac Surgery

brief_summary.textblock:
Cardiac surgery has been described as altering endothelium structure and function, notably because of the use of cardiac-pulmonary bypass (CPB). Among the endothelial structure, glycocalyx, the thin layer recovering the endothelial surface, may be altered by the inflammatory process and probably the modification of flow during CPB. Endothelial and glycocalyx integrity are essential for vascular function and glycocalyx destruction is associated with organ failure and mortality. On the other hand, a chronic alteration of glycocalyx is observed in many diseases such as diabetes, hypertension or chronic kidney failure, all pathologies frequently observed in patients benefiting grom cardiac surgery.
Thus the preoperative alteration of glycocalyx may be associated with postoperative organ failure.

primary_outcome.measure: association between preoperative sublingual glycocalyx thickness (glycocheck device) and major postoperative complications
primary_outcome.description: occurence within 48 postoperative hours of at least one item among: vasoplegic shock cardiogenic shock prolonged mechanical ventilation acute kidney failure Death

secondary_outcome.measure: association between preoperative sublingual glycocalyx thickness (glycocheck device) and death
association between preoperative sublingual glycocalyx thickness (glycocheck device) and cardiac arrythmia
association between preoperative sublingual glycocalyx thickness (glycocheck device) and Cerebral stroke
association between preoperative sublingual glycocalyx thickness (glycocheck device) and cognitive dysfunction
secondary_outcome.description: delirium or alteration of cognitive status

secondary_outcome.measure: association between preoperative sublingual glycocalyx thickness (glycocheck device) and myocardial ischemia
secondary_outcome.description: occurence of ischemia: new Q wave, new occlusion of a coronary arteria, elevated troponinemia with a new dysfunction of at least one myocardial segment

secondary_outcome.measure: association between preoperative sublingual glycocalyx thickness (glycocheck device) and acute respiratory failure
secondary_outcome.description: need for at least 5L/min of oxygen or non invasive ventilation of reintubation

secondary_outcome.measure: association between preoperative sublingual glycocalyx thickness (glycocheck device) and sepsis
secondary_outcome.description: new sepsis condition as defined by SEPSIS-3 definition

study_pop.textblock: All patients benefiting from cardiac surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- all patients benefiting from a cardiac surgery with cardio-pulmonary bypass
Exclusion Criteria:
- impossibility to carry out the measurement by glycocheck device
- refusal to participate
